intro: Oxydectes hieronymi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, velvety flowers. The plant typically has dark green, velvety leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Oxydectes hieronymi is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
